name: Westwood Studios
description: Famed for creating influential titles in the RTS genre including the Command & Conquer series and entries in the Dune RTS series.

name: Maxis Emeryville
description: Revolutionized simulation games in the 90s and early 2000s with the SimCity and Sims series.

name: Pandemic Studios
description: Developed the first two entries in the Star Wars: Battlefront series, first two entries in the Destroy All Humans! series, and created the Mercenaries Sage series.

name: Visceral Games
description: Founded as EA Redwood Shores that focused on licensed games such as Tiger Woods PGA Tour. The studio is best known for creating the Dead Space series and was rebranded as Visceral Games after the critical success.

name: NuFX
description: Developers of entries in the NBA Street, NBA Live, NCAA March Madness and FIFA Soccer series. They were merged into EA Chicago in the same year they were acquired and then shut down about three years later.

name: Playfish
description: Development studio that was focused on web games, most of which were available on Facebook. Was known for Resaurant City, Pet Society, and The Sims Social.

name: Black Box Games
description: A Canadian based developer that were most known for their work their entires in the Need for Speed series and cerating the Skate series.The studio was renamed to Quicklime Games before being shut down.

name: Phenomic
description: A RTS strategy game developer headqurtered in Germany known for the SpellForce and Battleforge. Before closure, they developed browser games Lord of Ultima and Command & Conquer: Tiberium Alliances.

name: DreamWorks Interactive / Danger Close
description: Game studio most famous for creating the Medal of Honor series. Rebranded as EA LA, they picked up the Command & Conquer series as well as creating the Lord of the Ring: The Battle for Middle-earth RTS series.
searchTags: Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth

name: Origin Systems
description: Texas based developer famed for groundbreaking work in RPG, flight sim, FPS, and MMORPG genres. Their work includes the Ultima, Wing Commander, and System Shock series. They released one of the earliest MMORPGs, Ultima Online.

name: Bullfrog Productions
description: British based game developer known at the time for their innovative and creative games such as the Theme Park, Dungeon Keeper, and Syndicate series.

name: Mythic Entertainment
description: American game developer that focused on MMO games and most known for developing Dark Age of Camelot.

name: Headgate Studios
description: An American developer that created entries in Tiger Woods PGA Tour. Rebranded as EA Salt Lake, they refocused on developing wii games before being transferred to Maxis division creating The Sims 3 expansion packs, before being taken out back and shut down.

name: Respawn Entertainment
description: An American developer founded by ex-cofounders of Infinity Ward, known for developing Titanfall, Apex Legends, and the Star Wars Jedi series. Has recently suffered canceled games and layoffs.

name: Hypnotix
description: US developer known for Deer Avenger and Outlaw sports games. Was folded into EA Tiburon upon being acquired.

name: Industrial Toys
description: US studio founded by Halo co-creator and Bungie co-founder Alex Seropian to create mobile games. Developed the Midnight Star series. Was working on the canceled Battlefield Mobile game when shut down.

name: Bioware
description: Canadian game developer that specializes in RPGs. Known for Baldur's Gate, Neverwinter Nights, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, Jade Empire, Mass Effect series, and Dragon Age series. Has recently suffered layoffs.
searchTags: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

name: Ensemble Studios
description: US video game developer known for creating the Age of Empires series and the first Halo Wars entry.

name: Monolith Productions
description: US video game developer that developed the LithTech game engine. They were known for developing FPS games such as Blood, No One Lives Forever, and the F.E.A.R. series. Other games of reknown in their catalog includes the Condemned Series and Middle-earth: Shadow of Morder series.

name: Tango Gameworks
description: Founded by Shinji Mikami, the company was almost immediately acquired by ZeniMax Media before being acquired by Microsoft in 2021. After the Microsoft shutdown, the studio was acquired by South Korean publisher Krafton. The studio is known for The Evil Within series, Ghotwire: Tokyo, and Hi-Fi Rush.

name: Lionhead Studios Ltd.
description: One of the many Bullfrog Productions breakway studios, the British developer is best known for the Black & White series and Fable series.

name: Telltale Games
description: American game developer known for their focus on episodic licensed adventure games, the famed Telltale approach first appeared in their breakthrough success The Walking Dead. This would lead to other licenses from Borderlands, Game of Thrones, Minecraft, Batman, and Guardians of the Galaxy. After the company went through assignment proceedings in 2018, several assets and the trade name were acquired by LCG Entertainment. As none of the key creative developers returned, this obituary is for the original incarnation of the studio.

name: Looking Glass Studios
description: A US developer famed for developing Ultima Underworld, the System Shock series, and the Thief series. The studio's laid the foundation for other immerseive action games that has influenced games such as Deus Ex and Dishonored.

name: Clover Studios
description: A semi-autonomous Japanese developer founded by Capcom, that focused on the creation of IP but failed to perform on par with Capcom's existing series. Capcom's attempt to merge the studio back into the company led to resignation of the studio members leading to the studio's closure. They were known for God Hang, ÅŒkami, and the Viewtiful Joe series.

name: Japan Studio
description: A Japanese studio that was part of Sony Interactive Entertainment. It was formed of multiple internal development teams including Team Asobi, Team Ico, and Team Gravity. As a division, they developed Ape Escape, Patapon, the Knack series, the Astro Bot series, Ico, Shadow of the Colossus, and Gravity Rush. Many notable employees left the company in 2021 and Sony eliminated all units except Team Asobi.

name: Team Bondi
description: An Australian developer that created their one and only game: L.A. Noire. After controversy over allegations of poor working conditions and financial difficulty, the studio was liquidated with Kennedy Miller Mitchell purchasing the studio's assets and IP. An attempted LA Noire successor game under KMM was then canceled around 2013.

name: Vigil Games
description: A US studio that developed the Darksiders series. The studio's parent company, THQ, went bankrupt in 2013 and while the Darksider's franchise was acquired by Nordic Games, nobody bid for the studio itself and it was subsequently closed. The original founder and many staff founded Gunfire Games in 2014. Amusingly, the new studio was then acquired by THQ Nordic (originally Nordic Games) in 2019.

name: Volition
description: A US studio that is most known for creating the Red Faction series and Saints Row series. Volition was of the many studios that was a part of the THQ bankruptcy. The studio was acquired by Koch Media (now Plaion) which was eventually acquired by Nordic Games' parent company, now known as the Embracer Group. The studio was closed as part of restructuring within the Embracer Group.
